title: D-Link DAP-1360 webproc Stack-based Buffer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of D-Link DAP-1360 routers. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the handling requests to the /cgi-bin/webproc endpoint. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of the length of user-supplied data prior to copying it to a fixed-length stack-based buffer. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of root.
addtionnal_details: D-Link has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://supportannouncement.us.dlink.com/announcement/publication.aspx?name=SAP10324
timeline:
2022-09-06 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2023-05-04 - Coordinated public release of advisory
